glosses: Initialism of Urho Kaleva Kekkonen (president of Finland in 1956 - 1982).
FAQ; initialism of usein kysyttyjä kysymyksiä (“frequently asked questions”).
Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic (the Bolshevik state of Ukraine)

words.etymology_text: From ukko (“old man”) + -nen and, less often, from Ukko (a given name) + -nen.

examples.english: O thou Ukko, god of gods, / Ukko, keeper of the clouds, / Ruler of the random cloudlets! / Open up the heavens wide, / All the windows of the sky!
examples.roman: Oi Ukko, ylijumala, / Ukko, pilvien pitäjä, / Hattarojen hallitsija! / Taivas auoksi avaos, / Ilma kaikki ikkunoiksi!

raw_glosses: (Finnic mythology) The god of heaven, often mentioned with the epithet ylijumala (“supreme god”).
glosses: The god of heaven, often mentioned with the epithet ylijumala (“supreme god”).

examples.text: —No, tottahan se on, Ukko Barndik sanoi:—Ei miunkaan nimeni ole tavallinen―mie olen Ukko, enkä mikkään ukko. Se on suomalainen nimi.
examples.ref: 1988, Ella Ojala, Pitkä kotimatka, Tammi, published 2005, page 300
examples.english: —Well, it's true, Ukko Barndik said:—My name ain't ordinary, either―I'm Ukko, and not any old man (ukko). It's a Finnish name.

examples.text: Mira hyppyyttää Ukkoa, sopottaa samalla jotain. Vauva hekottaa.
examples.ref: 2017, Terhi Törmälehto, Vaikka vuoret järkkyisivät, Otava, page 222
examples.roman: - Kerroinko minä että Ukko kastettiin sellaisella ikivanhalla pakanarituaalilla? Minulla oli tässä se kausi että kiinnostuin kaikista pakanajutuista. Wiccoista ja muista.

categories: Requests for translations of Finnish quotations

words.etymology_text: From ukko. The name is a euphemism; the real name of the god is uncertain.

forms.form: Rare. Only used with substantive adjectives.

examples.text: Avaruusolennot kuvataan usein pieninä vihreinä ukkeleina.
examples.english: Space creatures are often depicted as little green men.

a (usually animated) map showing thunderstorms within an area

hawker, darner (dragonfly of the family Aeshnidae)

words.etymology_text: Ukon (“Ukko's < Ukko, the supreme god in Finnish mythology”) + ilma (“weather”)

args.t1: Ukko's < Ukko, the supreme god in Finnish mythology

words.etymology_text: From Proto-Finnic *ukko. Probably a Finnic pet form of uros (“man, male”).

categories: Finnish terms derived from Baltic languages

words.etymology_text: From Proto-Finnic *uksi, possibly borrowed from Baltic (compare Lithuanian uoksas (“hole”)) or Proto-Finno-Ugric *ukse (compare Udmurt ӧс (ös)).
